newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia state ideology to have Internet homepage.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia state ideology to have Internet homepage.

text.p: Indonesia is getting set to spread the good word about its "Pancasila" state ideology via the Internet's World Wide Web, the official Antara news agency reported on Wednesday.

"We are making preparations to have our own homepage about Pancasila so that people can find information about it," the head of the government's body for the propagation of state ideology Alwi Dahlan was quoted as saying.
"Later there will be a Republic of Indonesia-Net and in that will be a homepage spreading the values of Pancasila," he told a meeting of editors in West Java. The report did not elaborate.
Pancasila, literally five principles, subscribes belief in one God, just and civilised humanity, national unity, democracy through consensus and social justice for all.
All Indonesian students and government officials must take regular refresher courses in Pancasila.
